Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: What Would You Do?
programme.desc: Using hidden cameras, host John Quiñones observes and comments on how ordinary people behave when they are confronted with dilemmas that require them either to take action or to walk by and mind their own business. Various scenarios are created that force people to make split-second -- and often surprising -- decisions, and variations of the situation (such as changing the genders, races or clothing of the people involved) are often featured to see if different reactions are elicited. Examples of situations on the show include a waitress being harassed by her boss, and a drunken valet trying to park cars.

Award-winning program anchored by David Muir, featuring unforgettable, character-driven true crime mysteries, exclusive newsmaker interviews, hard-hitting investigative reports and in-depth coverage of high profile stories.

programme.title: Engine Masters
programme.desc: The crew tests the effects of running long vs. short rods on otherwise identical engines; they'll find out if long rods make more torque, if shorter rods' faster swipe makes a difference, or if rod length doesn't actually matter.

programme.title: Engine Masters

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.desc: Big Papi was at his best when it mattered, heralded as the greatest playoff clutch hitter of all-time. Filmed over the course of just six weeks, David Ortiz: Legend Of The Fall documents the three time world champion's recent induction in the baseball Hall of Fame – capturing the lead-up to this momentous event, the actual ceremony and the afterglow of his enshrinement.

programme.desc: The Pulse with Bill Anderson is a weekly tv program and podcast featuring topical discussions and interviews surrounding current local issues, events, and entertainment. Each week Bill will welcome guests from all walks of life to talk about the topics that have the attention of our community and beyond. The Pulse will air weekly on FOX 29 in Philly as well as FOX Soul nationwide and be distributed on all major podcast outlets. In addition to hosting The Pulse Bill also manages the content of the station's special reports, including the Our Race Reality series of segments and specials. programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After foiling a girl's attempt to rob the general store, Lucas finds that she and her brother are plotting the murder of their abusive stepfather.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: A condemned killer being transported by train murders a marshal and takes Mark hostage.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Mark discovers that the new preacher and his wife are impostors planning a robbery.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: Lucas and Marshall Torrance get into trouble with the Army when they try to help a wounded young soldier who deserted.

programme.desc: A scout (Rod Cameron) leads a wagon train through territory made hostile by a violated treaty.

programme.title: Wagons West
programme.desc: A wagonmaster (Rod Cameron) bound for California has gunrunners and Indians to worry about.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Border Patrol agent Gene Autry and Pat help a rancher who is being terrorized. After preventing the attempted kidnapping of the rancher's daughter, they investigate the attacks.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and Pat join forces with a sheriff to uncover the murdering outlaws behind a silver dollar counterfeiting ring.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene and Pat discover the true identity of the outlaw called El Avengador when they rescue a girl being pursued by three men.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene is falsely accused of murder when he keeps information about a captured gunslinger's secret rendezvous.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Gene befriends two orphans whose older brother is involved with an outlaw gang.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Using hypnotism, Pat helps Gene solve a series of mysterious murders.

programme.title: The Gene Autry Show
programme.desc: Marshal Gene Autry aids Pat Buttram in exposing the murderer in a gold dust robbery. Gene and Pat search for the killer after an innocent man is falsely accused.

programme.title: The Train Robbers
programme.desc: After the death of her husband, Mrs. Lowe (Ann-Margret) posts a $50,000 reward in return for help recovering her train-robber beau's hidden fortune, under the pretense of returning it. Lane (John Wayne) assembles a group of cowboys to head to Mexico with Mrs. Lowe, enticed by the reward money. As they cross into Mexico, however, they realize they're being followed, by both a posse of bandits and a single mysterious rider (Ricardo Montalban) with his own agenda.

programme.title: The Searchers
programme.desc: In this revered Western, Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) returns home to Texas after the Civil War. When members of his brother's family are killed or abducted by Comanches, he vows to track down his surviving relatives and bring them home. Eventually, Edwards gets word that his niece Debbie (Natalie Wood) is alive, and, along with her adopted brother, Martin Pawley (Jeffrey Hunter), he embarks on a dangerous mission to find her, journeying deep into Comanche territory.

programme.title: Angel and the Badman
programme.desc: John Wayne stars as Quirt Evans, a man with a bad reputation, who falls for a wholesome Quaker young woman. Can he change his ways?

programme.title: McLintock!
programme.desc: A cattle baron with the diplomatic savvy to keep peace between dueling power brokers in town can’t seem to get his wife and daughter under control.

programme.title: Rio Bravo
programme.desc: When gunslinger Joe Burdette (Claude Akins) kills a man in a saloon, Sheriff John T. Chance (John Wayne) arrests him with the aid of the town drunk, Dude (Dean Martin). Before long, Burdette's brother, Nathan (John Russell), comes around, indicating that he's prepared to bust his brother out of jail if necessary. Chance decides to make a stand until reinforcements arrive, enlisting Dude, an old cripple named Stumpy (Walter Brennan) and baby-faced cowboy Colorado Ryan (Ricky Nelson) to help.

programme.title: Pale Rider
programme.desc: When a greedy mining company violently descends on a California gold rush town, a mysterious preacher on horseback rides in for the cause of justice.

programme.title: 3 Godfathers
programme.desc: Thieves and rustlers Robert Hightower (John Wayne), Pete Fuerte (Pedro Armendáriz) and the Abilene Kid (Harry Carey Jr.) rob a bank in a small Arizona town. Pursued across the desert by the indefatigable Sheriff Buck Sweet (Ward Bond), the trio lose their horses, suffer injuries, and come across a stranded woman (Mildred Natwick) who is dying while giving birth. Promising to carry the woman's newborn to safety, the repentant criminals struggle to reach the village of New Jerusalem.

programme.title: Chino
programme.desc: When an ostracized mixed-race horse breeder takes on a runaway teen and teaches him his craft, an unlikely friendship grows out of their hardships.

programme.title: The Young Land
programme.desc: U.S. justice is on trial for the Mexican-American community in 1848 after a white gunslinger kiills a Mexican man in a newly-American California town.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A town sick with smallpox awaits its vaccine, but bandits rob the mail rider and hold it for ransom.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: When a miner is trapped by a cave in, it's up to his pet monkey, Mr. X, to save the day.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: A woman who has inherited her father's ranch hires Cisco and Pancho for a roundup after they rescue her from a cowhand who was manhandling her. The cowhand wants revenge for being fired.

programme.title: The Cisco Kid
programme.desc: Cisco and Pancho are destined to cross paths with a pretty palm reader.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: The 1850's California gold fields is home to notorious bandit Joaquin Murietta. Matt and Frankie arrive to track him down but he kidnaps Frankie, believing she owns his hacienda.

programme.title: Stories of the Century
programme.desc: Tiburcio Vasquez vows vengeance against Anglos after his sister Dolores is killed. Matt and Frankie try to stop his terror in Southern California after a railroad agent is killed.

programme.title: The Legend of Butch & Sundance
programme.desc: The young outlaws (David Clayton Rogers, Ryan Browning) and their Hole-in-the-Wall Gang rob greedy land barons and become folk heroes.

programme.desc: After busting up a raid on the local newspaper office, Hoppy and the Bar 20 boys are temporarily deputized and asked to wrestle control of the town back from saloon owner Belle Langtry (Evelyn Brent).

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Murderer Sam Edwards has been sentenced to hang, but his brother, John, kidnaps Harris and takes him hostage to save Sam from the gallows.

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hope Jensen turns in a bag of stolen money that her husband had been forced to hide in their barn by Ben Jensen and his gang.

programme.title: Bat Masterson
programme.desc: Bat decides to pull a scheme on a woman in Deadwood who stole from him.

programme.title: Bat Masterson

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: After Mark contracts typhoid fever and has a vision of his dead mother he no longer seems interested in getting well.

programme.title: The Rifleman
programme.desc: An old friend of Lucas's returns to town in the company of a shady gambler and is accused of cheating at cards.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Mr. Proctor, a friend of the Derringer family, is sent to New Orleans with a message from a former general in the Civil War. But before he is able to relay the message to Yancy, Mr. Proctor is assassinated, leaving Yancy to uncover the mystery behind the Confederate half dollar Mr. Proctor was carrying when he died.

programme.title: Yancy Derringer
programme.desc: Yancy investigates counterfeit money that's being passed throughout the French Quarter. His investigation brings him into contact with Lonesome Jackson, a miner who recently struck in rich & seeking a wife. The Treasury Department suspects Jackson because of the large bankroll he's carrying, but Yancy believes that the miner is being set up as a patsy by the real counterfeiters.

programme.title: Waking Up to Christmas
programme.desc: After being zapped by faulty Christmas lights, a workaholic finds herself the lead in an over-the-top Hallmark-style holiday movie.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is The Compton Swan in Newbury, owned by Geoff Jones and Joan McGowan. Expectations are high after Joan reveals she was named Ireland's Business Woman of the Year.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Brighton Surf Hotel, Jeremy Mann and his Russian wife Elena hope their hands-off hosting style will win the day, despite the lack of breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Number 16, in Greenwich, London. Owner Robert Gray, an actor and antiques dealer, charms with his hosting, but Jan and Les find the dusty decor off-putting.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Fleur de Lis in Sandwich in Kent, hosts Jan and Les Fisher are convinced that their traditional place will impress their guests, but Robert is bent on revenge.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to The Barn at Dale End House near Matlock in the Peak District, owned by Sarah Summers. Sarah is dreading Robert's arrival, but all the guests are bowled over.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Starting in Betws-y-coed, North Wales, where at Llwyn Onn Guest House, bikers Wayne and Tracy Dunn hope their no-nonsense attitude will win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Parkwood Hotel in Stockton on Tees, where newlywed managers Jon and Chelli Bean are all about making things perfect for pooches.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to Great Glen in Leicestershire and The Pug and Greyhound, where Nicola Ellershaw and her colleague, Mackenzie Griffey, hope their super-stylish accommodation will dazzle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Solar Strand Hotel in Crosskeys, Wales, where former IT consultant Gary Pesticcio and his daughter, Naomi, hope their high-tech B&B will power them to victory.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Shoes, Durham, where landlord Billy Gowland and partner Debbie Nelson hope their footwear-themed pub BandB is the right fit for their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Biggin Hall Hotel in Derbyshire, where owner James Moffat and partner Annie Larner hope the BandBers will fall for the rural charm of their 17th-century farmhouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to yurt glamp-site, Forest Garden Shovelstrode in East Sussex, where hosts Charles and Lisa Hooper hope the BandBers buy into their woodland retreat.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Derby Manor Hotel and Restaurant run by mother and son team Fiona and James Milligan who opened their doors eight months ago after a million pound refurbishment.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Hope Mountain in North Wales, where husband and wife team, Rob and Jo Smith hope their dog-friendly B&B will win the day.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Beaumont Hotel in Louth, near Lincoln, where managers and best friends, Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks, pride themselves on being the `queens of clean'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Troy House in Painswick, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope their guests will fall in love with their rooms.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Flying the flag on day two are Norfolk couple Jenny and Richard Harmer, from Chimneys B&B in North Walsham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Copperfields Guest House in Broadstairs, Kent, where owners Neale and Julie Taylor hope their exclusively vegetarian B&B will stand out from the crowd.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit this week the group head to The George and Abbotsford in Melrose, Scotland, where host Andrea Gardner and front of house manager John Marr pull out all the stops.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Massimo's in Seaham, County Durham, where Italian chef Massimo Perrulli is joined by his cousin, Raf, on front of house. Emotions run riot as things come to a head.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off in Malvern, Worcestershire where retired pro-rugby player Steve Lloyd and partner Kathy Leather open their Copper Beech House to fellow B&B owners.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to the pet friendly Dog in a Doublet pub and restaurant in Peterborough where Della McGinn's passion for animals comes a close second to husband John's passion for food.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week, the B&Bers head to the Torcroft Boutique B&B in Torquay, Devon, where Europhiles Phil and Sharon Hobson hope their added extras will win over their rivals.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to the 600-year-old Rhydspence Inn in Herefordshire, owned by Mark and Lowrie Price. All guests are charmed by the medieval inn, but there's still underlying tension.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Maldon, Essex and The White Horse Inn, where hospitality expert Jayne and her husband, Pete Kocinoga, hope their attention to detail will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Barnfield B&B in St Osyth, Essex, run by Christine and her toy boy husband Paul Harman. Here, as well as offering rooms, Christine also runs spiritual retreats.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit the group head to The Black Swan Inn in Pickering, Yorkshire, where Phil and Jill have spent large sums to bring their 18th century inn up to their exacting standards.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The remaining six celebrity singers merge into one big group as they perform anonymously; J.B. Smoove guest judges.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: In the semifinal episode, two celebrities are unmasked, leaving only the top three singers. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger, Robin Thicke and guest panelist Kenan Thompson. Between all 12 of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. Singers will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. programme.title: Wipeout Australia

The lucky 12 that move through, battle it out with a giant toothbrush Sweeper. ‘Nat with the Tats’ and Renee ‘Lets get physical’ move through to the Dreadmill, flying the banner for the ladies. programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Sticky Buns; tasting of almond butter; review of waffle irons

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen
programme.desc: Classic Sloppy Joes, Chocolate Chip Cookie Ice Cream Sandwiches; review of kitchen sponges

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: America's Test Kitchen

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Gordon last left Laurence knowing that he had simplified his menu to have clean, simple, honest, traditional food using local produce. Surely this was enough to bring back the locals and win back the faith of the ex-pats.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. Gordon's not going to like what's happened in his absence.

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E10 - Semi Final 2

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E11 - Final

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E03 - The F Word

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E04 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: With landlord Brian's continual stress and interference in the kitchen, which Gordon believed was one of the main reasons for the inefficiencies of The Fenwick Arms, and now the added pressure of new competition, it's no wonder the pub is in trouble. programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E01 - Italian

programme.title: Ramsay's Best Restaurant
programme.desc: S01:E02 - Indian

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's first programme is Ruby Tates in Brighton, owned and run by ex-actor and failed Hollywood wannabe ALLAN LOVE. Situated in an affluent and trendy area just one street back from the beach, it's an oyster bar and seafood restaurant but Allan's never tasted the food because he hates fish.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's programme is The Priory, a 100-seater carvery in Haywards Heath, Sussex owned by ex IT consultant Scott. The former chapel of a nineteenth-century convent, the restaurant is in a spectacularly beautiful location and offers bargain roast dinners from a carvery that's been running for twenty years. Scott bought the place for £300k but with an ageing clientele eating for half-price, he's losing £5,000 a week.

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E05 - The F Word

programme.title: The F Word
programme.desc: S03:E06 - The F Word

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's second programme is Piccolo Teatro, a bijou vegetarian restaurant in Paris run by feisty Scot Rachel. A former waitress at the restaurant, Rachel bought it three years ago and now, along with best friend Stephanie, she's trying to convert the carnivorous French into a nation of veggies. For Gordon it's a sentimental journey to the city where he spent his formative years as a chef, a food mecca full of gastronomic delights that should be a dream.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's penultimate programme is The Curry Lounge in Nottingham, the city with more restaurants per square mile than any other in Britain. This 120-seater Indian restaurant has been run since January by ex sales director Raz who's new to the business - and it shows. Despite a ~500k refurbishment and décor like a Bollywood set the honeymoon period's well and truly over. His once-healthy trade is evaporating and at his current rate of loss it's uncertain he'll make it past Christmas.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The remaining six junior home cooks receive a special invitation to Gordon’s home for their next team challenge. Each team will prepare a two-course menu for a VIP lunch, including a seared red snapper appetizer and a roasted venison loin entrée. Later in the MASTERCHEF kitchen, the judges will reveal which team received the best overall feedback on their dishes and had the most successful lunch service and which contestants will be in jeopardy of elimination. Then, it’s up to the judges to decide who will go home and who will continue in the competition and compete in the semi-finals.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Chef Ramsay is in the Big Apple to revamp Dillon's, an Indian restaurant just blocks away from his own thriving eatery. Stubborn owner Mohammed loses approximately $25,000-$50,000 a month.

programme.title: Kitchen Nightmares - Censored
programme.desc: Located in Bellmore, New York, The Mixing Bowl faces an influx of competition and barely has customers. Chef Ramsay strives to correct problems with the restaurant's appearance and menu.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs pair up for a taste challenge in which the winners receive Vitamix blenders and a special trapeze lesson on the Santa Monica Pier.

programme.title: Hell's Kitchen
programme.desc: The chefs pair up for a challenge in which they must combine two countries' flavors to impress the guest judge, Roy Yamaguchi.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The chefs face their biggest challenge yet: a 55-foot wall.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: With Gordon Ramsay’s reputation on the line, the top six chefs face the ultimate challenge of taking over the world's largest Hell's Kitchen restaurant.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The chefs pull out all the stops with their fish dishes: line-caught North Sea mackerel with gooseberries; pickled shellfish and wood smoked crispy prawns with the `smell of the sea'; and smoked trout soup with beetroot, cucumber and oyster nuggets.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Kenny Atkinson, Tim Bilton and Lee Bennett are determined to win but which dish will take first place? Will it be roe deer with beetroot, cauliflower and sage; venison three ways with English garden vegetables; or braised feather blade of beef and Yorkshire pudding with beer and onion gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Which dessert will earn top marks? Strawberry jelly crumble with elderflower custard; a `Best of British' dessert plate - bread and butter pudding, rhubarb and custard, curd tart and strawberries and cream; or brandy snap with cider brandy cream, basil sorbet and summer fruits?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only one chef can make it through to the finals to represent the North East and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is going to come out on top?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Only two chefs can make it through to cook for the Great British Menu judges at the end of the week and one will be going home. That decision lies with former champion Marcus Wareing, who will scrutinise their dishes every day. Today it's the starters, so which dish will he think worthy of the banquet? Will it be poached & roasted chicken with new season onions, wild rabbit and leek turnover with piccalilli, or rabbit pudding with parched peas and gravy?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: For the fish course, which dish is going to be king: turbot with brown shrimps and spring vegetables, wild sea bass with shrimp toastie, or bream with hazelnuts and salted caramel?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course. Will the winning dish be Gloucester Old Spot pork with smoked venison, salt marsh lamb with sweetbreads, or oak roast middle white pork with broad beans?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Marcus Wareing chooses his favourite from the three dishes: caramel parfait with honey ice-cream, rhubarb and custard tart with beetroot ice-cream, and strawberries with meringue and mint water ice. For one of the chefs, this is the end of the road.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The heat is on, as only one chef can make it through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet hosted by HRH The Prince of Wales. Who is it going to be?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course for three of London and the South East's hottest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt Gillan is determined to make it to this year's banquet, but he faces fierce competition in the two newcomers.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The London and South East chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Marcus Wareing's protégé Mark Froydenlund - go head to head with their fish courses. Lee is hoping his modern plate of mackerel and passion fruit will outclass Matt and Mark's more traditionally inspired salmon dishes.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of London and the South East's finest chefs - Matt Gillan, Lee Westcott and Mark Froydenlund. Returning contender Matt is determined to bring home a 10 with his ambitious celebration of the billy goat but has he bitten off more than he can chew?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the London and South East chefs are striving to secure one of the two spots in tomorrow's Regional Final. The scores are close, so it's all to play for, as today marks the end of the competition for one man.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining London and South East chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by Mary Gwynn, author of the official WI centenary cookbook. Together they'll decide which chef goes through to represent the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland launch their culinary assault with the starters: braised hog's head with apple sorbet, white onion soup with roasted muntjac, and rabbit and smoked bacon salad.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland are all out to impress with their fish dishes: crab in barley soup with smoked oyster, hay baked rainbow trout and beetroot cured sea trout.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Daniel Clifford, Richard Bainbridge and Will Holland square off in the battle of the main courses. So which dish will get top marks: pigeon and rabbit with carrot terrine, lamb with purple sprouting broccoli or lamb with asparagus crown?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs from the central region to prove they've got what it takes to cook at the banquet. So which dessert will it be, heather honey custard with rhubarb, queen of puddings or lavender junket with mead jelly?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The gloves are off, as only one chef can make through to the finals and get the chance to cook at the banquet. Who is going to come out fighting?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course and as the chefs arrive they discover there's added competition following the London and South East region's shock result. The judges are joined by D-Day veteran George Batts.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fish course and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by Ken Sturdy who landed on Sword Beach on D-Day and who helped judge the North West region.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the halfway point in finals week and those chefs who have yet to get a dish onto the shortlist are feeling the heat. The judges are joined by Baroness Trumpington who worked as a cypher clerk at Bletchley Park from 1941 to 1946.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the chefs to get their dish in contention for the final banquet and those who've failed to finish in the top three so far are going all out. Joining the judges is Celia Sandys, Winston Churchill's granddaughter.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The pressure on the chefs to deliver is immense, and even the Great British Menu judges roll up their sleeves to ensure that the banquet goes according to plan.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Scotland's top chefs, Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee, and Graham Campbell - attempt to impress this week's veteran judge. Having missed out last year, returning finalist Jak is determined to make it to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell fight it out for the fish course. Graham is in a confident mood but returning finalist Jak and self-taught Jimmy are pushing him hard. Will the pressure prove too much for ambitious Graham?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Scottish chefs Jak O'Donnell, Jimmy Lee and Graham Campbell are battling to plate up a perfect main course for this week's veteran chef. Self-taught Jimmy is honouring his mum with his rendition of her Chinese beef stew.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Today it's the Scottish chefs' last chance to impress, with the dessert course. Only two can cook for the judges tomorrow, and with one chef in the lead after a triumphant main, the pressures on for the other two to plate up perfection.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Scottish chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, who will help decide which chef will go forward to the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the south west's finest chefs - Jude Kereama, Josh Eggleton and Dominic Chapman - attempt to impress a veteran judge with their starters. As the only newcomer in the kitchen, Jude is determined to plate up a winning dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three south west chefs fight it out for the fish course. Despite schoolboy errors during the starter, experienced Dominic is determined to get a high score on the course. But will newcomer Jude, a seafood master, overcome his nerves to plate up?.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: With a refined summer barbecue going up against a traditional Cornish speciality and a historic Wimbledon related recipe, who will come out on top? Andy Clatworthy is using his passion for historical cooking to reinvent a dish.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The south-west chefs have one last chance to impress as they face the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges; with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining south-west judges must cook their entire menus again for judges Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. Joining the judges is Radhika Bynon, a member of the Forest Gate Women's Institute, a modern urban group of women.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael are challenged to plate up perfect starter courses for this week's veteran judge. It's the first time in the Great British Menu kitchen for all three chefs, so who will triumph and who will fall?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Stephen Gomes, Adam Bannister and Phil Carmichael fight it out for the fish course. Experimental chef Stephen is determined to prove himself with a fish course honouring the WI's tradition of preserving, but he's up against stiff competition.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with the Welsh chefs going head to head. With all three chefs paying homage to Welsh lamb; Adam with a refined dish, Phil with a dish dedicated to his Mum and Stephen with a lamb dish celebrating the WI.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the tricky dessert course and the last chance for the Welsh chefs to secure their place in tomorrow's regional final. With everything to play for, the pressure is fierce. Only two can make it through, and one will leave the competition for good.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Two remaining Welsh chefs cook their four courses again for the judges and Rosemary Bishton. One chef will be chosen to represent Wales in the National Finals taking them a step closer to cooking at the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of Northern Ireland's top chefs - Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold - go head to head with their starter courses to impress this week's veteran judge. Former champion Chris is back for glory and determined to reach the banquet, but he's up against two newcomers with their sights firmly set on victory.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold are cooking their fish courses. Ambitious Ben is determined to steal Chris's regional crown, but under fierce scrutiny from this week's formidable veteran, will the pressure to deliver spell melt down?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course for three of Northern Ireland's finest chefs - Chris McGowan, Danni Barry and Ben Arnold. Ambitious Ben is out to prove himself with a perfect lamb main course.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's dessert day and the Northern Irish chefs are all striving for one of the two spots in the Regional Final. The pressure is intense, and in the end one chef must leave the competition empty handed.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North Irish chefs are cooking all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by a guest judge - award winning food writer Felicity Cloake.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen are going head to head this week for a chance to represent the North East region in the National Finals. Today it's a battle for starter course, and the first chance to impress their formidable veteran chef.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the fight for the fish course, as three of the North East's finest chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - are out to impress. After his risky starter caused a stir yesterday Michael is planning another controversial dish in honour of the WI's support of women's rights.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Three of the North East's most dynamic chefs - Mini Patel, Michael O'Hare and Tim Allen - go head to head cooking their main courses. Michelin-starred Tim is super keen to bag the first ten of the week, but Michael and Mini are hot on his heels.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the North East chefs' last chance to impress with the dessert course. It's been a week of highs and lows, modern audacious dishes and classic masterpieces but with only two places up for grabs cooking for the judges, at the end of today who will leave the competition empty handed?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North East chefs must cook all four courses again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They're joined by a guest judge - WI president Kirsty Bowen from Sheffield - who will help decide which chef will go through to represent the North East in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: Representing the North West are Eve Townson, Matt Worswick and returning contender Mark Ellis. Today's the starter course, and after failing to cook for the judges last year Mark's out to redeem himself but he faces stiff competition in executive chef Eve and young gun Matt.

programme.title: Great British Menu

Eve and Matt are hoping their classic approach to cooking fish will win the day whilst Mark is going all out with fishy take on a traditional dessert recipe.

With big boots to fill, Angela Hartnett's protégé Pip is the only newcomer in the kitchen. Will she beat the boys to claim victory?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The three Central Region chefs - newcomer Pip Lacey, 4th time competitor Richard Bainbridge and returning chef Jason Hodnett - fight it out in the fish course. Pip is hoping to outclass her rivals with a smoked haddock dish inspired by her Grandma.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for the main course with three Central Region chefs - Pip Lacey, Richard Bainbridge and Jason Hodnett. Once again Jason is taking risks with his unusual collection of ingredients.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the last chance for the Central Region chefs to impress, with the dessert course. Only two chefs can go through to cook for the judges so with everything to play for, who will plate up perfection and who will be sent packing?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining Central Region chefs cook their entire menus again for the judges - Prue Leith, Oliver Peyton and Matthew Fort. They'll be joined by former chair of the Women's Institute Helen Carey, who will help decide who will have the glory of representing the region in the National Finals.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the starter course, and eight of the finest chefs in the country are battling it out to plate up impeccable dishes worthy of the Women's Institute. The judges are joined by WI Calendar Girl Angela Baker, but after Oliver reveals that this year it will be much tougher to make it onto the judge's shortlist, who will keep their cool and secure a place?

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's the battle for the fish course, and those chefs who didn't make it onto the shortlist with their starters are hoping to do better. The judges are joined by a WI president, Kristy Bowen, who knows the impeccable standards the Institute will expect.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's main course day, the half-way point in Finals Week, and those chefs who have yet to get a dish on the shortlist are feeling the heat. With only dishes judged to be perfect in with a chance at reaching the WI banquet, the standards are higher than ever before.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: It's a battle for dessert, and the last chance for the eight regional champions to get a dish in contention for the final banquet. Those who've failed to make the judges shortlist so far are going all out. Joining the judges is author of the WI centenary cookbook Mary Gwynn.

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The banquet is finally here. It's the culmination of months of hard work as the winning chefs strive to plate up perfect dishes for the ladies of the Women's Institute, at London's historic Draper's Hall where pioneers of the WI once gathered.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As Monty brings in the summer harvest, he gives advice on what to sow to keep the crops coming up to the end of Autumn. Carol Klein visits a woman who is losing her eyesight and gives her recommendations of plants that will be a feast for her senses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Monty Don meets Dick and Pauline Beijen, who moved from Dick's native Holland to a 44 acre plot in Devon.

programme.title: My Dream Farm
programme.desc: Rob and Sue Wood moved from London to Cornwall to live a more self-sufficient life.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill reveals some exciting news. After years of dreaming, she finally has her very own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting umbellifers and making some changes to the dry garden. He also sows peas and pots on his dahlias. Carol reveals exciting plans for an ambitious show garden she's designing for the RHS Hampton Court Palace Garden Festival.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Adam visits a walled garden in Somerset to meet a group of volunteers who are gardening alongside those who need help to transform their lives. At Longmeadow, Monty creates two different planting schemes for pots for shady spaces, transplants grasses in the jewel garden, and plants out his favourite varieties of tomatoes.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Gardeners' World comes from the first big flower show of the season: the RHS Malvern Spring Festival. Arit Anderson and Joe Swift discover the newest varieties of plants and flowers that are hot off the potting bench.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and sweetcorn and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, and Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of growing aubergines.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don uncovers the extraordinary stories behind Britain’s seventeenth century gardens.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don arrives in the eighteenth century, an age that gave rise to the landscape garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team return with a celebration of spring. There's been plenty going on over the winter and lots of new projects in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential rose pruning, Monty plants clematis and rocket, cuts back grasses and makes a start on sowing annuals for colour this summer.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As plants begin to show their early growth, Monty gets plenty of plants for free when he demonstrates how to make the most of herbaceous perennials. He also cuts back pelargoniums that have overwintered in the greenhouse and makes a start on sowing vegetables. Nick Bailey shares plans for his new garden in Northamptonshire and shows how to create a container garden ideal for those on the move. Frances Tophill discovers more ways to use cut flowers as she visits a florist in Devon.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With spring gaining momentum, Adam Frost gets to work on his veg plot and plants his first lot of potatoes. He introduces roses to his borders, and in a quest to increase biodiversity, has a radical plan for his lawn. Joe Swift meets a garden designer who, facing the challenge of two awkward, adjoining plots, transformed them into wonderful, cohesive spaces. And Rekha Mistry demonstrates how to grow the perfect onion from seed and has a go at growing cotton.

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: A single mum of two in Redditch, Holly's garden has turned into a virtual jungle. Can the intrepid threesome come up with a plan to give this family a safe and fun place to play?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and Harry and David Rich start with a clean slate in Rutland, and come to the aid of Manjinder. She wants to create an interactive and colourful space to pass her love of gardening on to her two small nephews. Can the team make it happen on her small budget?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: Charlie Dimmock and the Rich Brothers travel to Andover. Animal-lover Sue would like to share her garden with the hedgehogs who live in the neighbourhood, so which designer will create a space both safe and beautiful?

programme.title: Garden Rescue
programme.desc: With two little ones and a home renovation going on, Cardiff couple Nadine and Steve have paid little attention to their spacious garden. Can Charlie and the boys come up with design ideas that blend entertaining spaces and room for growing children?

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets his new vegetable garden underway by making raised beds. He also offers advice on how to cut back herbs. Nick Bailey marks the 400th anniversary of the death of William Shakespeare when he investigates the fact and the fiction behind the Bard's potions and poisons, at the Chelsea Physic Garden; and we visit Pashley Manor in East Sussex to unearth the story behind the planting of over 25,000 tulips.

programme.title: On Deck
programme.desc: For someone like Capt. Cory who's out on the water most days of the year, it's easy to notice the little changes that show the stress on an ecosystem. Whether that's subtle movements of fish from lingering red tide blooms or large-scale impacts from high-volume Lak Okeechobee discharges, he sees it all, and he's ready for things to change. "I wish we would get to a point where we really put our foot down and do something about it before it's too late."Watch this episode to learn more about what's going on and to see why Capt. Cory is so passionate about fighting to protect the places he loves. Visit https://captainsforcleanwater.org to join the fight.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Nikki Boxler’s life in Update New York on her family farm raising cattle and producing maple syrup is a few thousand miles from the hills of New Mexico. We’ll take a look into Nikki’s life back home and then follow along as she visits the small town of Quemado and its bustling population of 228, while she pursues bugling elk with her favorite Winchester in hand. We’ll also head to Missouri and Texas to chase whitetails with Chris Keefer and Paul Sawyer.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: We set out to tell the tale of Marion - and his legendary Mack’s Prairie Wings, smack dab in the middle of the world famous Stuttgart, Arkansas - the land of ducks and rice. Get an inside look at a man that many consider to be larger than life, from those that knew him best, like his cousin and fellow hell raiser, Bud McCollum. We’ll even hear a story or two from Milton Stovesand, an 81 year old former waterfowl guide and Mack’s employee who actually guided John Olin a time or two, and ran the timber holes with Marion. It’s timber holes and tall tales. It’s cups of coffee and cupped up wings. It’s partners in business, and partners in potholes and it’s pure Arkansas...just like Marion.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Shotgun sports are experiencing unprecedented growth, with competitions across the country gaining popularity as enthusiasts vie to be the best shooters in the world. Every summer, the Amateur Trapshooting Association hosts The Grand American in Sparta, Illinois. This year marks the 125th Anniversary for the largest trap shooting competition in the world. We’ll talk with the people who make this tournament run behind the scenes and explore what makes this tournament such a special event. We’ll also look at the rich history of The Grand. On-site we’ll chat with the curator of the Trapshooting Hall of Fame and look at some of the incredible historical pieces on display in the museum. Additionally, we’ll learn about White Flyer and how the clay manufacturer has made important innovations for the shotgun sports.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks heads to Illinois to test out the new 360 Buckhammer straightwall cartridge.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Brad Rucks gets a chance to punch a long awaited Wisconsin sturgeon tag and then chats with the local DNR to learn about sturgeon spawning season.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Father/son duo Brad and Noah Rucks are after the same giant whitetail that's making regular appearances on their family farm.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Retired army nurse Linda Powel wins a dream hunt in Texas hosted by Record Rack Deer feed. What's the catch? Linda has never hunted a day in her life!

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: David Gilane chronicles the last couple of years of him going down to Texas and chasing exotic axis deer.

programme.title: Modern Hunter
programme.desc: Team members Dan and Brad head to the lush spring landscapes of Wisconsin, aiming to double up on some elusive spring turkeys.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Explore the dominance hierarchy that emerges as bucks compete forbreeding rights. Then, watch Mark Kayser hunt Kansas where he sets his sights on a massive whitetail buck.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Heroes are honored and embark on the hunt of a lifetime at the Bucks for the Brave event hosted by Record Rack and Trinity Oaks Non-Profit.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: In this special 20th-anniversary episode, "Deer & Deer Hunting TV" takes a nostalgic journey through two decades of hunting television. Hosts Dan Schmidt and Brad Rucks lead viewers through memorable moments.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Anatomy Hunter Brian Johnson shares his meticulous research on deer anatomy and behavior, guiding Dan through the critical factors that determine the perfect shot placement.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Dan Schmidt and Mark Kayser demonstrate the strategic use of terrain and natural cover to outsmart big whitetails. Then Mark heads to fill his tag in the rugged landscapes of South Dakota.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: John Sewell has played a huge part in the development of feeding Fortified Cottonseed 365 days a year. Laramie Barrett of Fortified Cottonseed joins John for a great weekend of hunting at his ranch in Uvalde, Texas. This is a great time for Laramie to get away from the office and see the first hand of how their product is performing.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Cable is a huge supporter of Texas Hunting and everything Teas Trophy Hunters. We are blessed to spend a few days with hum at the beautiful Saddle Creek Ranch in Brady Texas. Greg has a tight management plan and we are glad we got to enjoy his ranch with him and his team.

programme.title: Working Class Hunter
programme.desc: For Dale, it’s not just about the big bucks. His passion lies in the hunt itself, and when it comes to taking does, he’s unstoppable. Dale’s love for the outdoors and his commitment to the craft make every hunt special. Join him as he stacks does and shows what real hunting is all about.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin Leake takes redfish tournament pro Fred Meyers out of his comfort zone to talk trash and chase tarpon just a few hundred yards off a lively Panama City Beach.

programme.title: FinQuest
programme.desc: Ryan Miller targets exotic fish in Lake Ida with local guide Kevin Cannon in Episode 2 of FinQuest. Catching peacock bass and clown knife fish, Ryan also enjoys family fun with a skimboarding session in Jupiter, Florida.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Last season, Black Cloud joined W.E. Phillips at his Duck Club in the Arkansas Timber. W.E. Phillips was one of the original "Duck Men" in the classic Duck Commander Duck Men series with the Robertson family. On this hunt, W.E. tells stories of the old times and shares some CRAZY duck hunting strategies.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: Dr. Duck and Billy Campbell take a break from hunting public waterfowl to hunt sandhill cranes with Prairie Bomb Outfitters. They're in the thick of the action.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Life On The Water

programme.title: Duck Camp Dinners
programme.desc: Chef Jean-Paul Bourgeois and the crew are back at it for season 3 of duck camp dinners. With a historically dry year in Louisiana, the team dodges marsh fires, hunts alligators, and prepares for the opening day of teal season.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike heads to Crystal river to chase Redfish in his new Cayo Skiff.

programme.title: Blair Wiggins Outdoor
programme.desc: The season finale, where we take a look at all the highlights of the season and some of our favorite moments.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: The Local Knowledge crew heads to Catalina Island off the coast of Southern California to participate in the 2024 War Heroes On Water tournament. This event offers a unique opportunity for the sport fishing community to create meaningful connections with our nation's heroes while raising awareness of the challenges they sometimes face when transitioning back to civilian life. With a little bit of luck and a lot of teamwork, Ali and Rush hope to put their veterans on a Bluefin tuna bite they won't forget!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: For Ali and Rush, one of the best aspects of fishing is being able to share experiences on the water with interesting people. On this episode we invite luxury watch enthusiast Eric Rivera - AKA "Watch Eric" to the Florida Keys to target Permit and Amberjack in the Gulf.

programme.title: Chucktown
programme.desc: It's early May in Charleston, and Redfin Charters is prepping for another epic season where its team of captains will run more than 3,000 fishing charters in search of redfish and trout.

programme.title: Louisiana Catch and Cook
programme.desc: Escape to the beautiful shores of Grand Isle, Louisiana where musician and community advocate David St. Romain joins Chef Jay Ducote for a weekend of fishing, crabbing, and oyster harvesting. Watch as Chef Mark Boudreaux of Hurricane Hole transforms their fresh catch into a culinary feast. Enjoy the thrill of fishing, the joy of cooking and the camaraderie of camp in The Bayou State.

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: Get ready for an exciting episode of the Tidewater Diaries! Join us as we dive into an action-packed adventure with former NFL Pro, Brandon Linder. Get set for adrenaline-pumping moments, captivating stories, and a glimpse into the world of a sports star turned adventurer. Don't miss out on this thrilling episode of the Tidewater Diaries!

programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: The highs and lows of fishing teach us to ride the wave, and the captains, mates, and everyday Costa Rican citizens have a phrase for such a mindset – “Pura Vida.” Those two words are more of a cultural ethos than a casual expression, and a reminder to remain smiling, thankful, and to never sweat the small stuff.For the crews and anglers of Los Sueños, the good days far outweigh the bad. Nestled inside a small nook of Playa Herradura, Costa Rica’s Los Sueños Resort and Marina serves as a luxury embarkation point for some of the world’s most heralded bluewater fishing. Many places tout similar claims, but numbers don’t lie: It is common for a single boat to release over a dozen marlin in a single day, and the area holds perhaps the largest concentrations of big Pacific sailfish anywhere.

programme.title: Captain's Log
programme.desc: Captain Jonathan Moss is fishing the South Carolina low country with Captain Stephen Flook Jr. The weather is cold and windy, but the plan remains the same, FULL SEND!

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton stays close to home and heads to the Lake of The Ozarks joining Austin Culbertson for a frigid couple days of fishing. The cold weather doesn’t hold back the fish, though, as they target brush piles with jerk baits and umbrella rigs.

programme.title: The Cast
programme.desc: Trenton and Trevor pack up and drive down to Arkansas for their first experience on the White River. Though the White is much larger waters than back home, Trevor utilizes his experience to catch them even while wading.

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: The Cast

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this episode of Huckberry Homes, we caught our good friend and photographer James Barkman out in the wild. He gave us a tour of his vintage ""Yellow Submarine"" inspired VW Van and broke down some of the modifications he has made to make this adventure bus feel more like home.

programme.title: Huckberry Homes
programme.desc: "On this special edition of Huckberry Homes, we explore Floki Studios. Floki Studios is a renowned recording studio nestled in the rugged seaside of Iceland, offering artists an unparalleled environment for creativity and collaboration. Situated on the fringes of the Arctic Circle, this sanctuary provides a haven far removed from the bustling distractions of urban life. Surrounded by the untouched beauty of Iceland's pristine nature, Floki Studios is more than just a recording space; it's a haven designed to inspire and enhance the creative journey.Behind the scenes, Floki Studios thrives thanks to a dedicated team, deeply committed to the art of music. Jay Sweet, the Music Ambassador, stands out for his passion and advocacy for artists, embodying the studio's ethos of nurturing creativity. This partnership between Jay and the Floki Studios team exemplifies a unique blend of individual dedication and collective effort, providing artists with a space that fosters creative freedom and collaboration."

programme.title: Tidewater Diaries
programme.desc: Get ready for an exciting episode of the Tidewater Diaries! Join us as we dive into an action-packed adventure with former NFL Pro, Brandon Linder. programme.title: AFTCO Original Film
programme.desc: The highs and lows of fishing teach us to ride the wave, and the captains, mates, and everyday Costa Rican citizens have a phrase for such a mindset – “Pura Vida.” Those two words are more of a cultural ethos than a casual expression, and a reminder to remain smiling, thankful, and to never sweat the small stuff.For the crews and anglers of Los Sueños, the good days far outweigh the bad. Nestled inside a small nook of Playa Herradura, Costa Rica’s Los Sueños Resort and Marina serves as a luxury embarkation point for some of the world’s most heralded bluewater fishing. Many places tout similar claims, but numbers don’t lie: It is common for a single boat to release over a dozen marlin in a single day, and the area holds perhaps the largest concentrations of big Pacific sailfish anywhere.
